description: Generated by pyang from module nsd
title: nsd

schema-version.description: Schema version for the NSD. If unspecified, it assumes v3.0

mgmt-network.description: Flag indicating whether this network is a VIM management network

root-bandwidth.description: For ELAN this is the aggregate bandwidth.

leaf-bandwidth.description: For ELAN this is the bandwidth of branches.

vim-network-name.description:
Name of network in VIM account. This is used to indicate
      pre-provisioned network name in cloud account.

short-name.description: Short name to appear as label in the UI

physical-network.description:
Name of the physical network on which the provider
network is built.

vnfd-connection-point-ref.description: A reference to a connection point name

ip-address.description: IP address of the connection point

vnf-depends-on-ref.description: Reference to VNF that sorce VNF depends.

name.description: Name of the configuration value pool

start-value.description: Generated pool values start at this value

end-value.description: Generated pool values stop at this value

default-value.description: Default Value for the Input Parameter

xpath.description: An xpath that specifies the element in a descriptor.

units.description: Measured Counter Units (e.g., Packets, Kbps, Mbps, etc.)

vnfd-id-ref.description: A reference to a VNFD. This is a leafref

vnfd-monitoring-param-ref.description: A reference to the VNFD monitoring param

member-vnf-index-ref.description: Mandatory reference to member-vnf within constituent-vnfds

value-string.description: Current value for a string parameter

max-length.description: Maximum string length for the parameter

min-length.description: Minimum string length for the parameter

value-decimal.description: Current value for a decimal parameter

value-integer.description: Current value for an integer parameter

widget-type.description: Defines the UI Display variant of measured counters.

group-tag.description: A tag to group monitoring parameters

vnfd-id-ref.description:
A reference to a vnfd. This is a leafref to path:
   ../../nsd:constituent-vnfd
   + [nsd:id = current()/../nsd:id-ref]
   + /nsd:vnfd-id-ref

floating-ip-required.description:
Boolean parameter to indicate whether the CP must be exposed.
A public IP address will be allocated to this CP if exposed is true.
The default is false meaning a floating IP address is not required.
It must be explicitly asked for a floating IP address to be allocated.

vnfd-connection-point-ref.description:
A reference to a connection point name
   in a vnfd. This is a leafref to path:
       /vnfd:vnfd-catalog/vnfd:vnfd
       + [vnfd:id = current()/../nsd:vnfd-id-ref]
       + /vnfd:connection-point/vnfd:name

vld-id-ref.description: ID reference to a VLD in the NS

logo.description:
File path for  the vendor specific logo. For example icons/mylogo.png.
The logo  should be part of the network service

key.description: Key associated with this key pair

seq.description: Sequence number for the configuration primitive.

data-type.description: Data type associated with the value.

charm.description: Juju charm to use with the VNF or VDU.

script-type.description: Script type - currently supported - Scripts confirming to Rift CA plugin

seq.description: Sequence number for the configuration primitive.

data-type.description: Data type associated with the value.

user-defined-script.description:
A user defined script. If user defined script is defined,
the script will be executed using bash

default-value.description: The default value for this field

data-type.description: Data type associated with the name.

parameter-pool.description: NSD parameter pool name to use for this parameter

read-only.description:
The value should be dimmed by the UI.
Only applies to parameters with default values.

hidden.description:
The value should be hidden by the UI.
Only applies to parameters with default values.

name.description: Name of the metric, as defined in the Juju charm.

key.description: Key associated with this key pair

name.description:
Place group construct to define the compute resource placement strategy
in cloud environment

requirement.description:
This is free text space used to describe the intent/rationale
behind this placement group. This is for human consumption only

strategy.description:
Strategy associated with this placement group
  Following values are possible
    - COLOCATION: Colocation strategy imply intent to share the physical
                  infrastructure (hypervisor/network) among all members
                  of this group.
    - ISOLATION: Isolation strategy imply intent to not share the physical
                 infrastructure (hypervisor/network) among the members
                 of this group.

member-vnf-index-ref.description: Member VNF index of this member VNF

short-name.description: Short name to appear as label in the UI

member-vnf-index.description:
Identifier/index for the VNFD. This separate id
is required to ensure that multiple VNFs can be
part of single NS

start-by-default.description: VNFD is started as part of the NS instantiation

start-address.description: Start IP address of the IP-Address range associated with DHCP domain

enabled.description: This flag indicates if DHCP is enabled or not

count.description: Size of the DHCP pool associated with DHCP domain

subnet-prefix-pool.description: VIM Specific reference to pre-created subnet prefix

address.description: List of DNS Servers associated with IP Profile

gateway-address.description: IP Address of the default gateway associated with IP Profile

subnet-address.description: Subnet IP prefix associated with IP Profile

min-instance-count.description:
Minimum instances of the scaling group which are allowed.
These instances are created by default when the network service
is instantiated.

member-vnf-index-ref.description: member VNF index of this member VNF

count.description:
count of this member VNF  within this scaling group.
The count allows to define  the number of instances
when a scaling action targets this scaling group

scale-in-operation-type.description:
Operation to be applied to check between scaling criterias to
check if the scale in threshold condition has been met.
Defaults to AND

cooldown-time.description:
The duration after a scaling-in/scaling-out action has been
triggered, for which there will be no further optional

scale-out-relational-operation.description:
The relational operator used to compare the monitoring param
against the scale-out-threshold.

scale-in-threshold.description: Value below which scale-in requests are generated

scale-out-threshold.description: Value above which scale-out requests are generated

scale-in-relational-operation.description:
The relational operator used to compare the monitoring param
against the scale-in-threshold.

ns-monitoring-param-ref.description:
Reference to the NS level monitoring parameter
that is aggregated

scale-out-operation-type.description:
Operation to be applied to check between scaling criterias to
check if the scale out threshold condition has been met.
Defauls to OR

threshold-time.description: The duration for which the criteria must hold true

enabled.description: Specifies if the scaling policy can be applied

max-instance-count.description:
Maximum instances of this scaling group that are allowed
in a single network service. The network service scaling
will fail, when the number of service group instances
exceed the max-instance-count specified.

vnfd-egress-connection-point-ref.description:
A reference to a connection point name
   in a vnfd. This is a leafref to path:
       /vnfd:vnfd-catalog/vnfd:vnfd
       + [vnfd:id = current()/../nsd:vnfd-id-ref]
       + /vnfd:connection-point/vnfd:name
   NOTE: An issue with confd is preventing the
   use of xpath. Seems to be an issue with leafref
   to leafref, whose target is in a different module.
   Once that is resolved this will switched to use
   leafref

vnfd-ingress-connection-point-ref.description:
A reference to a connection point name
   in a vnfd. This is a leafref to path:
       /vnfd:vnfd-catalog/vnfd:vnfd
       + [vnfd:id = current()/../nsd:vnfd-id-ref]
       + /vnfd:connection-point/vnfd:name
   NOTE: An issue with confd is preventing the
   use of xpath. Seems to be an issue with leafref
   to leafref, whose target is in a different module.
   Once that is resolved this will switched to use
   leafref

order.description: A number that denotes the order of a VNF in a chain

vnfd-id-ref.description:
A reference to a vnfd. This is a
   leafref to path:
       ../../../../nsd:constituent-vnfd
       + [nsd:id = current()/../nsd:id-ref]
       + /nsd:vnfd-id-ref

short-name.description: Short name to appear as label in the UI

vnfd-id-ref.description:
A reference to a vnfd. This is a
   leafref to path:
       ../../../nsd:constituent-vnfd
       + [nsd:id = current()/../nsd:id-ref]
       + /nsd:vnfd-id-ref

id.description: Identifier for the classifier match attribute rule.

vnfd-connection-point-ref.description:
A reference to a connection point name
   in a vnfd. This is a leafref to path:
       /vnfd:vnfd-catalog/vnfd:vnfd
       + [vnfd:id = current()/../nsd:vnfd-id-ref]
       + /vnfd:connection-point/vnfd:name
   NOTE: An issue with confd is preventing the
   use of xpath. Seems to be an issue with leafref
   to leafref, whose target is in a different module.
   Once that is resolved this will switched to use
   leafref
